title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: R. S. Lacey to Orlando Brown, September 7, 1866
summary: Lacey describes conditions in several counties, including Augusta County. He writes the the local government levied a poll tax to support the poor, but does not know if it will take effect in time for the winter, and notes the opposition to establishing schools for blacks in rural areas.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Aid/Relief, Employment/Labor, Legal System, Education, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
